snippet: The clothing retailer’s shift to expensive knitted sweaters was unsuccessful, and a sales promotion confused shoppers.
abstract: Clothing retailer Express Inc cuts its forecast for the current quarter, highlighting the dangers of resorting to promotions that fail to clearly communicate value to the customer, ahead of the crucial holiday selling season; shares of Express, which caters to 20- to 30-year-old men and women, fell $3.33, or 22 percent, to $11.68, their lowest since the company was taken public in 2010 by the private equity firm Golden Gate Capital.
lead_paragraph: The clothing retailer’s shift to expensive knitted sweaters was unsuccessful, and a sales promotion confused shoppers.

headline.seo: Express Cuts Its Forecast as Promotion Falls Short
headline.main: Express Cuts Its Forecast as Promotion Falls Short
headline.print_headline: Express Cuts Its Forecast As Promotion Falls Short
